utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s so funny?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Nothing. Just thinking about the noises people make during sex.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I do sometimes get a bit carried away, don’t I?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s cute. You sound a little like a drunken monkey. Ooh-ooh-ooh-ooh!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know it’s meant as a compliment.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That’s how I take it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: This is perfect. I hope this moment never ends.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, gotta go.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh! Already? Why don’t you stay over?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, I’d love to, but you know my mother needs me in the morning.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Please, I think the woman can manage to put a wig on by herself.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s not just the wig. It’s pinning her hair up, drawing on her eyebrows. It’s a two-person job.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s just, when you leave right after we make love, it makes me feel cheap.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, honey, I’m sorry. What can I do?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Stay.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay. Like, what, another five, ten minutes?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Go home.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Your call.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard, have you ever considered us living together?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Boy, I don’t know. You, me, Ma living under the same roof?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, I mean just you and me. You can move in here, or we can find a place.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ve got a better solution.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We wait for my mom’s heart to explode from all the salt she eats. Then we just stick her in the ground, flip her mattress and move into the big bedroom.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look at us planning a future together.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (voice)
utterance.content: Who’s there? Are you a sex criminal?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sex criminals don’t have keys, Ma.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: Where were you so late?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I was out with Bernadette.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: I know what that means, I watch Dr. Phil. I hope to God you used a condom!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m not having this conversation with you, Ma!

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: God forbid you get one of those new fancy sex diseases!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nobody has a disease!

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: I hope not. I share a toilet with you. Is that what you want? To give your mother herpes?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s it. I don’t have to take this. Good luck with your eyebrows in the morning!

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: Who’s there? Are you a sex criminal?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m still leaving! I just forgot my Claritin.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I need a place to crash.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, sure. Why?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Big fight with my mother.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Still arguing over which CSI is the best?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, we agreed they all have their merits. This was about Bernadette.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Howard’s gonna sleep here tonight. He had a fight with his mother.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you offer him a hot beverage?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, social protocol states when a friend is upset, you offer them a hot beverage, such as tea.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Tea does sound nice.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You heard the man, Leonard. And while you’re at it, I’m upset that we have an unannounced houseguest, so make me cocoa. Point of inquiry, given that Leonard is your secondary friend and Koothrappali is your primary friend, why didn’t you seek refuge under his roof?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: There’s no room. His sister is staying with him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wait, wait. What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Cocoa, Leonard. Focus. I’m down in the dumps here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Priya’s in town?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, some work thing. Anyway, my mother seems to think that Bernadette…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hold on. When did Priya get here?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know. A couple of days ago. The thing is, Bernadette doesn’t like that I have to take care of my mother, and my mother doesn’t trust Bernadette.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s a real pickle. Bye.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t worry. As your tertiary friend, I am prepared to step in and comfort you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s not really necessary.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, no. I’ll finish making the tea, while you narcissistically ramble on about whatever’s troubling you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s what tertiary friends are for.

utterance.speaker: Raj (inside)
utterance.content: Who is it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You can’t come in.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I just want to talk to her.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I forbid it.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Open the door, Rajesh.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You heard me. I forbidded it.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Forbidded it?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Forbaded it?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Get out of the way. What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: I have business in Los Angeles.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why didn’t you call?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Clearly, she was sending you a message to take a hike, Mike.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I thought about calling, but I just wasn’t sure if seeing you was such a good idea.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know. Last time I came on too strong. Can we talk in private?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s completely inappropriate for a single woman to entertain a man in private. If you insist on talking, you must do it on the couch! All right, you may talk in the bedroom, but I want this door to remain open! All right, just this once you may close the door. But keep in mind I’ll be right out here monitoring the situation! Oh, damn it. Leonard, when you get this message, call me. Priya, this is your brother. When you get this, tell Leonard to check his voicemail.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Would you be sleeping over again this evening? Because you’re welcome to.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s very nice of you, but I made other plans.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, just keep in mind that should you ever need a slightly apathetic tertiary friend, I stand at the ready.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Hi, Howard. Hi, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why are you holding hands? I forbid you to hold hands.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Rajesh, you know Leonard and I spent the night together.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, but you were just sleeping, because I forboded you to have sex.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The word is forbade.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you sure? That doesn’t sound right.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Listen, Rajesh, Leonard and I have decided to see each other again, and you don’t get to tell me who I can and can’t have a relationship with.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Actually, he can. The Hindu Code of Manu is very clear in these matters. If a woman’s father is not around, the duty of controlling her base desires falls to the closest male member of her family, in this case, Raj. The code also states that if she disobeys, she will be reborn in the womb of a jackal and tormented by diseases. If true, that seems like an awfully large gamble given that the prize is Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: There it is, Priya. We’re Indian. We believe this stuff.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: I think it also says that if you eat beef, you need to live with cows for three months and drink their urine.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Some of it makes sense, some of it’s crazy. My point is, you can’t go out with Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Penny (arriving)
utterance.content: Who can’t go out with Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: My sister.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny, this is Raj’s sister, Priya.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: It’s very nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, you, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Priya, if you’re experiencing any tension or awkwardness, it may stem from the fact that Leonard and Penny used to, if I may quote Howard, do the dance with no pants.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, Bernadette, can I talk to you for a second?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Penny, you became disenchanted with Leonard as a lover. Would you please tell my sister why?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Listen, my mom’s going to Palm Springs to visit her sister. That’s two whole nights in a row I can sleep over with you all the way to morning. Unless the desert air dries out her sinuses, in which case I’ll have to schlep out there with the big humidifier.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That’s it? That’s your big solution to all of our problems? If your mom’s nose holds up, we get two nights together?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Isn’t that great?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, it’s not great. You need to make a choice. Me or your mother.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, uh…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Wrong answer.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, wait. You didn’t let me finish.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m listening.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Uh…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Agh!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I came as quickly as I could.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Why?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: To comfort you, of course. Sheldon told me about Leonard dating Rajesh’s sister. So I high-tailed it over here to pick up the pieces of your broken heart.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Amy, I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You don’t have to be strong for me. Now let’s talk about Priya, that man-stealing bitch.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: In situations like this, best girlfriends are often catty about the other woman. Rawr.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really, I am not upset about Leonard and Priya.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh. Then perhaps you don’t understand what’s going on. Your former boyfriend has replaced you with what appears to be a very suitable mate. Arguably much more suitable than you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Well, good for him. Hey, what do you mean, more suitable?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, granted, Penny, your secondary sexual characteristics are reasonably bodacious. But Priya is highly educated, she’s an accomplished professional, and she comes from the culture that literally wrote the book on neat ways to have sex. Whereas you, on the other hand, are a community college dropout who comes from the culture that wrote the book on tipping cows.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. Okay, I got it. I got it. So, what is all that stuff?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: This is a portable electroencephalogram. I’m doing research on emotions and brain activity. So when you start crying, I can see which region of the brain is activated. Then I’m going to stimulate the analogous area in the brain of a rhesus monkey and see if he cries. Cool, huh?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I choose you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yep. I moved out of my mother’s house. Cord is cut. I’m all yours.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What did she say when you told her?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know. She hasn’t responded to my email yet.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: This is so great. I love you, Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I love you, too. So what’s for dinner?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, I don’t really have much of anything in the house.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s fine. Why don’t we go fool around in our bedroom? And then you can go shopping.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I thought maybe after we eat, we could see an early movie.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: I’d love that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I love the way you say, I’d love that.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: She says it the same way I do. I’d love that. Everybody in India says it that way. It’s not a big deal.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Rajesh, don’t be a child.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m not being a child. Leonard, I swear to God, if your sister ever comes to town, I shall have my way with her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: My sister’s 38 and married.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: All the more shame that will fall upon the house of Hofstadter.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ooh, I thought I smelled pizza.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s remarkable. If pepperoni were an explosive substance, you could replace German shepherds at our nation’s airports.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Hi. Penny, right?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yes. Hi, hi. I’m sorry. I didn’t know you had company. I don’t want to impose.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, no. It’s not an imposition. At this point, in our ecosystem, you are akin to the plover, a small scavenging bird that eats extra food from between the teeth of crocodiles. Please, fly into our open maw, and have at it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: If I had more than a box of baking soda in my refrigerator, I wouldn’t have to take that.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hi, bestie.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi. So, um, Priya, you’re a lawyer, right?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: I know. Pretty boring, huh?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, come on. It’s not boring at all. She’s currently helping set up a secondary derivative market which would allow overseas car firms to hedge their investments against potential advancements in battery technology. Hmm?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Thank you, Leonard. That doesn’t make it sound boring at all.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So, how you holding up?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, who are you kidding? She’s breathtaking.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: So, Penny, Leonard tells me you’re an actress. That must be pretty exciting.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, yeah. It’s real great. Today I drove to Van Nuys for an audition I thought was going to be for a cat food commercial. Turned out to be porn.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you get the part?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I didn’t do the audition.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Given the state of your career, can you really afford to be picky?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: I took acting classes when I was at Cambridge. I loved it. We did Taming of the Shrew.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, wow. I love Taming of the Shrew. I did a paper on it in high school. Who knows not where a wasp does wear his sting? In his tail.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: In his tongue.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Whose tongue?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Yours, if you talk of tails, and so farewell.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What, with my tongue in your tail?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m regretting my earlier cattiness. She is an absolute delight.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wow, indeed.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I can’t believe we’re finally living together.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. You know what would make this moment perfect?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: A little snack. You got any string cheese?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No. I, I might have some cheddar.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not as good. You can’t make strings with it. Remind me to put it on your shopping list.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You have hypo-allergenic detergent?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Better put it on the list. If you wash my underwear with regular soap, I get little red bumps on my tuchus.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Wait a second. I’m doing your laundry?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, honey, it’s not gonna do itself. Oh, before I forget, tomorrow morning, you’re driving me to the dentist.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I have to take you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You don’t have to take me. You get to take me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Are you telling me your mother usually takes you to the dentist?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s not weird. There’s lots of kids there with their moms.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I can’t believe this.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What? It’s fun. If I have no cavities, afterwards, we go out for a treat.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: All right, Howard, let’s get something straight right now. I’m not going to be your mother.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa! Where did that come from?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Who’s that? Is it a sex criminal?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nobody wants to do that to you, Ma.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: Where were you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Didn’t you read my email?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: You know I can’t turn on that ferkakta computer. I left you some brisket on the kitchen counter.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: Remember to floss after. We have the dentist in the morning!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, hey. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I just wanted to check in on you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It seems like the appropriate thing to do when one’s best friend finds herself replaced by a smart, beautiful woman with the smouldering sexuality of a crouched Bengal tiger.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I already told you, I’m okay with it. I mean, if anything, I’m quite pleased that Leonard has found someone that makes him so happy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s okay, it’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Now, let’s get these electrodes attached and see what’s going on in that pretty little noggin of yours.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I smell Chinese food.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s actually Thai. You’re slipping.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Are Leonard and Priya here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They went to Catalina for the weekend.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Where’s Raj?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: At home, forbidding it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How about Howard?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m given to understand his mother grounded him for running away.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, okay. Well, I guess it’s just the two of us, huh?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Actually, it’s the three of us.

utterance.speaker: Amy (on webcam)
utterance.content: What up, bestie? Good news. Thanks to you, I was able to make a rhesus monkey cry like a disgraced televangelist.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So, you feeling better?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, you have a guest who’s upset.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Right. I’ll make tea.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, sweetie, it’s okay. I don’t want tea.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry. It’s not optional.
